website_summaries.verdict: This bedside commode's best features are comfort and stability. If safe transfers from wheelchairs or walkers are a concern, we highly recommend this drop-arm model.
pros: Padded seat and arm rests are very comfortable
Drop arm design good for transfers
Can be used over taller or elongated toilets
cons: Some sharp edges may be exposed
Not designed well for male users
Bucket is small and difficult to position properly

customer_reviews.title: Great for a woman, not so great for a man
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews and agree that it is sturdy, comfortable, easy to assemble, etc. However, the bucket does not fit properly for use by an adult man - it is probably perfect for a woman. If you slide the bucket toward the front of the rail, there is a gap in the back. If you slide the bucket toward the back of the rail there is a gap in the front. If someone can tell me how to address the "gap" issue, I'd appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Christy K

customer_reviews.title: Best commode chair I found so far
customer_reviews.text: Best commode chair I have found so far. Greatest feature is the slide out pot that can be removed while someone is still seated. My only complaint is that the front of the seat becomes uncomfortable when sitting for a while because of the wood under the padding. I would still recommend it over all of the other commode chairs that I have tried. UPDATE: I updated my review to five stars after using the chair for a while. I have also found great 3/4” expanding stem casters from Service Casters Company to use with the chair to give it mobility and locking wheels.
customer_reviews.author: MrWms

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I got a defective product. One side arm got stuck and won't be able to flip up. One of the legs is crooked and so the balance of the 4 legs is terrible. I need a replacement quick since my 100-year-old grandmother is really needing a good bedside portable toilet.
customer_reviews.author: Vinh Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: very messy!
customer_reviews.text: This commode is terrible for my father, he cannot get back far enough on the seat and urine goes all over and the bucket doesn't fill the whole hole, you have to either position it more to the front or the back.....what a mess!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy's Review ☺️

customer_reviews.title: Fickle mother approved
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom who has MS and she really likes it. It's sturdy yet can be adjusted in every way to make it just right for the user. This commode is also cushioned on the backrest and seat, and my mother reports that it is by far the most comfortable commode she has ever used. This thing also seems to be incredibly durable and well made, so I doubt I'll ever need to get her a replacement! I have bought other commodes for my mom in the past, and she hated all of them. This one is a definite winner.
customer_reviews.author: Melly

customer_reviews.title: Commode seat opening is LARGE, bucket is regular sized.
customer_reviews.text: The commode is strongly constructed. The commode seat opening is LARGE, the bucket is regular sized. IMO the commode seat opening is for a very LARGE person. The area between the arms is what you would expect for a regular-sized person. The bucket fits the seat rails, but is tooo small for the seat opening. As someone already said the bucket works for a small male or a normal-sized female. With the size bucket that is provided a regular-sized or larger male would have to move the bucket between doing operation one and operation two.
customer_reviews.author: J Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great Commode
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with the cheap, plastic, uncomfortable commodes that are the standard issue. My husband simply could not sit on them. This commode is worth the price, very comfortable for long sits. It is easy to clean and wide enough for most, sturdy too. By the way, instead of plastic liners I use compostable bags for countertop compost garbage cans. I dump commode waste into toilet and put bag in regular garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Judyc135

customer_reviews.title: Provides the greatest comfort and flexibility.
customer_reviews.text: The cushioning is much more comfortable than the traditional plastic seats. The frame is steel making it heavier than an aluminum frame; and , in turn, more secure. The adjustable back support was especially helpful for fitting to body size. Though a little more in cost than aluminum models, I consider this delux steel model to be a worth while investment. We use it in the bathroom permanently over the commode without the pot attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money especially if this will be the primary toilet for somebody.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a wonderful chair. It is very stable and has the softest seat. Believe me, that is a great feature for boney bottoms or if u end up sitting on it too long.
customer_reviews.author: veronica

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and comfortable commode
customer_reviews.text: We bought this commode for me to use in the first few weeks of my total hip replacement surgery recovery as it was hard getting through the bathroom door- would have to go sideways through the door with my walker. We bought a different one at Walgreens before this and that one wan't roomy enough, had no padding on the seat, and did not have drop down arms. This commode was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: D. Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy commode, but we have had a problem with the hinges for the seat. I am a large lady, over 200 lbs and I can't stand to get onto the commode. I have a slide board and have to slide to get on and off the chair. The hinges are plastic and we had to replace them with something stronger. I know most everything is made of plastic, please can this be made of a stronger plastic or metal? If we had not had the problem with the hinges I would have given a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Jones

customer_reviews.title: The arm rests are sturdy, but wiggle a little when she leans on ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Has been a lifesaver for my mother. She said the opening in the front makes it much easier to clean herself. The arm rests are sturdy, but wiggle a little when she leans on them due to their ability to drop. On the lowest setting, the toilet seat is a fraction higher than she would like. To make it easier to empty, we buy odor-control kitchen trash bags and put in kitty litter and gel ( No more bags leaking into the trash can.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: The seat!! Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: This toilet is terrible for my husband. His legs slip down into the cut out. Why wouldn’t it be made with a complete circle? I originally thought it would be great with the padded seat and the drop arms. The drop arms are great but that seat!! We are stuck with it until we get another one that we ordered. Also the bucket doesn’t even cover the hole and the wire slips out. I almost had a horrible mess when I was emptying it and one side of the wire came loose!! I think they could do better with a few modifications!
customer_reviews.author: ShellyP

customer_reviews.title: Chair rusts with less than two months of use
customer_reviews.text: We have had the chair seat for a senior for less than two months and it is rusting right under the seat. Too late to return it and now it's impossible to clean and sterilize. Find another brand as this one is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Whidbey

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Heavy-duty construction. Heavily padded seat and backrest. Adjustable leg length. It's got everything that I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Starkist89

customer_reviews.title: Best option
customer_reviews.text: As a community health nurse there is nothing better than the combination of a padded seat, padded arm rests, and sturdy construction. High quality.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Reed

customer_reviews.title: arrived damaged. the back rest was detached from the ...
customer_reviews.text: arrived damaged. the back rest was detached from the metal part with both the bolt and screw detached leaving large hole in back rest, and couldn't be repaired. photos explain it all..
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Most sturdy chair I’ve purchased in the past 12 years
customer_reviews.text: Most sturdy chair I’ve purchased in the past 12 years. I bought it for the shower and planned on traveling with it. It’s way too heavy for that, so will use it at home in the shower. The reason I didn’t give it 5 stars is that the adjustable legs do not let it sit shorter which makes no sense. It is very tall.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carter

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty, designed for a big man, not tippy like most
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous! Both arms collapse so you can easily slide from wheelchair. Heavy duty , not tippy, comfortable. Best $100 I've spent on our medical equipment
customer_reviews.author: Sue Miles

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This “adjustable” commode had no adjustable legs making it useless. The Medline customer service was just as useless. After contacting them, it basically came down to being our problem not theirs. So, we’re shipping it back to Amazon and will not purchase from Medline again.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Meza

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy for unsteady folks
customer_reviews.text: My husband is wheelchair bound and we needed a chair sturdy enough for him to lean while transferring. I removed our toilet seat and put this chair on top of our toilet. Works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: David Brownstein

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful if you need a higher seat
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble getting up and down with low toilet seats because of leg issues. This product definitely helped ease that problem and gave my legs time to heal. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Liked: can adjust height, sturdiness, padded seat and arms can fold down. Dislike: design flaw in that splash guard would benefit redesign to wider oval brim. I just put a waterproof pad under commode in case any drips. Overall, functioned way better than other commodes and served its purpose for my elderly mother after hip replacement surgery.I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ali D.

customer_reviews.title: Very good chair
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy. If you're going to have to move it around, I recommend getting furniture moving pads underneath it to make it easier to move. The arms go down very easily it's been a very good chair.
customer_reviews.author: pavalkado

customer_reviews.title: Skip over the cheaper seat elevators -  this is one of the safest and sturdiest -  built to last
customer_reviews.text: After trying every other elevated seats out there - I finally caved and bought this one . It's one of he more expensive products in this category- but worth it
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: Metal parts except hinges
customer_reviews.text: Hinges are plastic. If they break, you can use pipe hangers to repair.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Cahill

customer_reviews.title: This is a sturdy and rather heavy commode
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy and rather heavy commode. We have issues with the bucket not fitting well under the seat. Sort of like it's too small. In plain language, if you are a man you have a choice of what you are going to catch #1 or #2 but you aren't going to get both in one "sitting". The bags you get to go in the bucket don't fit this commode well either and tend to slip down inside. We have gone back to the lighter standard one you can get at any medical supply.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Benner

customer_reviews.title: Has a hole in the pot.
customer_reviews.text: It has a hole in the plastic potty so it is totally useless. Please send a new plastic pot. Chair is ok. Should I send the pot back? How could you send a potty chair with a hole in the pot>
customer_reviews.author: amazonfan#1

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and functional but seat needs improving
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and functional but the seat isn't that comfortable. If they made it a little softer and contoured differently, this would be a fantastic commode. Oh... and the pail is smaller than on the earlier model, leaving room for splashing. I got out the pail from the old commode.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry G

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with both brackets that hold seat on frame broken. Unable to use. Returning for a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used one at Mercy Hospital Acute Rehab Unit over in Sacramento. I was so pleased with it that I bought two. One for downstairs and one for upstairs. I've also used it as a shower chair. At 6'-5" and 210 lbs. This is a great chair!
customer_reviews.author: David Gary Peaslee

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This item is made of steel and not the typical aluminum. It is extremely durable and sturdy, and I feel absolutely safe using it. The rigid, padded seat, takes only 2 screws to attach, otherwise it arrives completely assembled. I like that it is easy to clean, and LOVE that one or both armrests easily fold down.
customer_reviews.author: 5280Lady

customer_reviews.title: Best home bedside toilet I found!
customer_reviews.text: The padding is comfortable and well-placed. Drop arms are perfect. Adjustable, yet sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: K Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Very well made product, sturdy and built to be safe
customer_reviews.text: Had a full knee replacement. Product is well made, strong, very supportive. Highly Recommend Just could not do without.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S

customer_reviews.title: Will work fine over a toilet
customer_reviews.text: This will work fine over a toilet without the bucket. Doesn't work so good with the bucket. The bucket is to small, it had to be slid back and forth for my husband to use it. There is also gap between the top of the bucket and the seat. It's enough of a gap to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and comfortable if you're a plus size
customer_reviews.text: I love how sturdy the whole frame is and the seat is comfortable! The one thing that I don't like is where the seat flips up the only thing holding the seat on are two little plastic attachments and I'm completely paralyzed so I use a transfer board to transfer and the very first time I used this chair one of those attachments broke because I slid the seat trying to get on it from the side with my transfer board. Other than that I absolutely love the chair!
customer_reviews.author: leona reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Paraplegic RV'r!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! easy to assemble, sturdy. fold down arms work easily and every time. Handles of arms are neoprene for no-slip grip. Seat is quality vinyl and soft. Easy to adjust height. Great for bowel care if you're a para! Did a lot of research before buying this for my para husband for our RV. Great thing is back and front legs adjust to different levels, so it can be used over the RV toilet on a pedestal base with no problem Also, the width is right to fit in the spot allowed us by our Winnebago Navion RV. Fold down arms work in place in the RV as well.
customer_reviews.author: Harry and Sally

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good commode
customer_reviews.text: Does the job overall. We found that dropping one arm next to the bed presented the threat of falling between the bed and the commode. Leaving the arms both up provides something to guide a person into the correct position. The only other thing we didn't care for was that the pail does not cover the full opening leaving a small space either forward or rear open. It works as long as the person sits fully on the seat. Since our user only uses the commode for urination, we place it a bit forward, which works for us. Easy to assemble and solid.
customer_reviews.author: R. Thrall

customer_reviews.title: Not something I'd normally order, but much needed!
customer_reviews.text: Soft on the toosh, easy to transfer too from wheelchair, and affordable! Beats a bedpan by far if your mobile enough to make it to this chair! Fits great over a standard toilet, it's a great buy!! Amazon you are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: JON A KITAHARA

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty but uncomfortable. Padding does not allow for easy transfers. Drop arms hard to do by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: ein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy and high quality. My 86 year old mom loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Strong,Great For Women as Well as Men
customer_reviews.text: It comes almost completely assembled and is easy to set up the rest of the way. Great for women since the padded seat is open in the front and the arms don’t restrict the legs when drying. It’s not cheap but is well made. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mike CFL

customer_reviews.title: some good things, and some bad things.
customer_reviews.text: I am a fluffy person who is in a wheelchair. Pros sturdy made to hold up to 350 lbs and you can tell. Comfortable the padded seats are great, the bucket has a handle so easy to carry. Cons: seat is NOT wide enough for a fluffy person. Bucket does not fill the hole in seat.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Hospital Grade - Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. My mother loves it. This is a solid built medical device. This is not junk. Very well made. I am surprised at the price. Takes 10 minutes to put together and easy to do so. Highly adjustable as well. Rare to find such a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Scott Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: A lot nicer and heavier duty than I expected it to be. If you have to have a bedside commode I think this should be the one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and easy to assemble. When it arrived the box was damaged and so was the back rest - the vinyl was punctured. I contacted Medline. They sent me an email (We will reach out to our warehouse and will forward the details when we receive a response.) They never responded to me. However, I did receive a replacement backrest within a week. Do I recommend purchasing this product? YES!
customer_reviews.author: N. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Portable commode
customer_reviews.text: This product would have rated a five for me but, I could not because right now, I'm in NEED to purchase this item for a third time, except I NEED it in a larger size and I don't know why but, this product is not made in a bigger size. This is why my rating is a four and not a five. The forgotten people that is in NEED of this product....NEED it in a larger size!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent as expected
customer_reviews.text: Strong, works as a stand alone or put over your toilet.Quality product, well made, comfortable to use.
customer_reviews.author: D. John Crannell

customer_reviews.title: This is a quality product. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This product is very stable due to its weight. It is very comfortable with a padded back and seat. The arms will drop down for a board transfer and the bucket is easily accessible when the seat is lifted. Adjusts to any height necessary and is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed for my wife. Well made. Very heavy. Not easily tipped over.
customer_reviews.author: ed

customer_reviews.title: Speedy delivery!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product and I needed it like that day, it arrived a day earlier than expected which was a life saver for me. By it arriving then it has made my life and the patients much easier. Thanks for a great item that was exactley what it said it was. Good product excellent customer service= one happy and satisfied customer. Most definitely recommend this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: works great.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic "U" brackets secure the seat to the frame. Both were broken into three parts upon delivery. I replaced them with steel brackets from the local hardware store. Otherwise, works great.
customer_reviews.author: piefoot

customer_reviews.title: Gave great comfort to my 95 year old mom
customer_reviews.text: Mom was having a tough time getting to her bathroom in middle of night and this really solved her problem. Very sturdy, the liners (bought separately) make this very easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Product is sturdy. It fits over ADA height toilet. Got this for my son who is disabled. He weighs 270 pounds. His occupational health nurse and I searched for a sturdy product with a flip down arm with a wide opening so he could clean himself and this met all the criteria.
customer_reviews.author: vlrogers47

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: Chair is handy since I have trouble lifting my husband. His legs are weak and the bathroom in not real close. Prior to getting the chair he was falling so am happy I made the purchase. Andrea
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: This commode is very stable and the padding is perfect for a thin patient who previously got bruises just from sitting on a regular toilet seat. The only negative is that if used over a regular toilet, we found we had to remove the toilet seat and lid from their upright position so the commode would sit back far enough over the toilet. The seat opening is slightly large for a small adult but it is so much more comfortable that this is a minor problem.
customer_reviews.author: M.C.

customer_reviews.title: For what I use it for, it's been useful
customer_reviews.text: The padding on the seat is soft enough, and the adjustable heights are helpful. Having armrests that are easy to move out of the way is helpful. I use it as a shower chair in an open shower configuration. Allows for fairly easy washing in areas that are hard to get to when you can't stand up to get there. As a spinal injured disabled person, I find it to be useful. I don't use the toilet function very often, but having that as an option allows some flexibility for me when bathroom issues are not going the way I'd like for them to.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for so many needs.
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the price. Better than buying many different items. Can be used next to the bed or over the commode. Very sturdy. Nice solid feel for anyone In a weakened condition. Adjusts in height, arms can be raised or lowered independently as needed. Comfy foam seat and back rest. So glad I found this at Amazon. Perfect aid.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie L

customer_reviews.title: Better than what they have in the hospital
customer_reviews.text: I was in hospital for six months during which my body atrophied after four months of lying on my back and not being able to move. When I started my rehabilitation in hospital the commodes they had were horrible. As I lost all of my skin and nails my current skin is very thin and tears easily. The cushioned seat was a tremendous assistance to me. The commode is sturdy and does not tip if leaned on. If you require a commode or toilet seat adapter, this is your product.
customer_reviews.author: ChiefBard

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken. Seems the parts that broke are cheap plastic. Not good. Options to return make you send this very large item back to whence it came for a refund. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: A Feldman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I use this for therapeutic vaginal steams in my office and this works great. I use a ceramic bowl and not the plastic one that comes with it because of the heat. It was easy to assemble and is very sturdy. I took off the lower legs to have it sit lower to the ground for my purposes and it is perfect. It is nice to be able to fold away the arms as I don't need them at all. If I could change one thing about it, it would be to have a curved back. The padded back is flat and not as comfortable as it could be for a back rest.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: I received this commode today and one of the plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this commode today and one of the plastic hinges on the seat was completely broken away. The shipper had also, obviously, thrown the box around, and it was punctured in several places, thus the broken hinge? There was no padding of any kind to hold the chair in place. Maybe plastic shrink wrap over the seat would help prevent this breakage in the future. Going out now to find steel or aluminum hinges; ugh! 'not worth the trouble to return it; mom comes home tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: Alex van Gils

customer_reviews.title: Type of person who would use it.
customer_reviews.text: Made for large people or obese people. Anybody under 150 Lbs they're cheeks will fall through the hole, on the padded seat>m
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: This chair is well made but not very comfortable. The seat is narrow with the handles on
customer_reviews.text: This chair is well made but not very comfortable. The seat is narrow with the handles on. The opening is smaller than usual. I bought this for me teenage son who is average size. We needed the handles so it is a little difficult to get in and out of. Delivery was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Sinacola

customer_reviews.title: She says this is perfect and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 87 mother in law. She says this is perfect and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Commode
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my husband - 6'1" and 250+ lbs. The large seat, adjustable back, sturdy arms, and drop sides are a plus in addition to the heavy duty construction. I line the bucket with supermarket plastic shopping bags which fit perfectly. We originally bought a portable commode but it wasn't strong enough for someone his size. As always when ordering from Amazon, it arrived sooner than we expected.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Ok but seat doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Good toilet but after awhile the seat cushion starts coming apart and I couldn’t find a replacement so I had to put in the trash and buy a new one instead of just replacing the seat
customer_reviews.author: Delores

customer_reviews.title: Damaged Product
customer_reviews.text: This was a needed item for my 84 year old Mom who is still, remarkably. self sufficient. She has knee issues and this was intended to ease night walks to the bathroom if the urge arose. According to her the unit is solid. However, the seat back within the box was cut as shown in the attached photo. The box in which it shipped was intact. To return is more of a hassle for her than to keep......This just should be noted.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy design yet comfortable (i.e. metal and padded). Arms stay in place well, like the rotation option. Leg height adjustable, although perhaps one more shorter setting needed for people around 5" tall. Easy to assemble. Great all around. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Philip H

customer_reviews.title: When you gotta use one, you dont want it to painful time use, this one isnt painful
customer_reviews.text: 10 times better than what hospitals use, more comfortable by 100 times
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Portable commode
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and comfortable. A little trouble getting it together. I used it when I had hip replacement.,
customer_reviews.author: S McBride NP

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my mother' passed away before I was able to use this, but I was looking for a drop-arm commode so that moving her from the hospital bed to the commode would be easier. This is well-constructed, sturdy and heavy enough to hold larger people. I am keeping this one in our cellar and giving away the lightweight ones from Medicare. I rated it 4 stars only because of the smell of ammonia or some strong disinfectant. It still has not dissipated, and seems to involve the padded seat. Tried washing and spraying the plastic-covered seat, but the smell is still there.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Commode
customer_reviews.text: Well crafted and packed Medline Commode is an excellent, very usable addition for the bathroom of elders and others who may need assistance sitting and getting up from the commode. Padded seat is very comfortable and the arms that go up and down are really helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin J. Vice Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Lele have quite a few disappointments using Amazon
customer_reviews.text: The commode arrived with a back support split from one end to the other. Instead of sending it back bought me some high-dollar tape and repaired it that way. Brand new out-of-the-box very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect commode for my stepfather who had a stroke. The padded seat made it much more comfortable than the previous one he was using. The drop-arm made it easier for his caregivers in the tight space.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: You have to put a lid on every time you use it
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don’t like is you have to put the lid on every time you go to the bathroom, could of made it with a seat cover that you could just close
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my overweight family member. Glad the arms can come down. Worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Quiltaholic

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy. Easy to clean. Easy to transport. Best chair we ever bought for our needs.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been severely disabled for 8 years. We LOVE this chair over ALL the other ones we've tried, both in the home and in the hospital!
customer_reviews.author: D. L. I.

customer_reviews.title: Solid stable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and sturdy which was the number one thing we were looking for !!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary M Espejo

customer_reviews.title: Great chair but no longer a need for same
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband who passed away before he could get home to use it. Would like a refund on my discover card and would like to return at Kohl's in Cary. Need a return #. on phone at 919-780-7838
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Other options with the same quality cost doble of the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the best option for the price. The swivel arms do easy the lateral transfer
customer_reviews.author: ElLuiGo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Well built and sturdy. Served its purpose with no issues or problems.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J.

customer_reviews.title: Far better and heavier construction than any other I looked at ...
customer_reviews.text: Far better and heavier construction than any other I looked at or tried. Especially good for a man. The front of the padded seat allows your "junk" to be properly positioned for use on the chair---just as on a regular commode seat. Well worth the extra dollars. Pop-up handles work seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: SWWA

customer_reviews.title: It has been absolutely perfect for her situation
customer_reviews.text: I researched this model online and purchased it just before my wife had a total hip replacement. I placed it beside the bed and adjusted height to allow her not to have to bend more than necessary. It has been absolutely perfect for her situation. She loves the padded seat, the sturdy arms to hold on to as she sits,and the ease with witch it can be emptied. I couldn't be more pleased with the looks, function, and convenience of this Commode. I rate it 5 stars. db
customer_reviews.author: DONALD E BROWN

customer_reviews.title: needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: The catch bucket is not right. It needs to be more oval shaped at the top, because when a big person is sitting on it, there is no way you can do #1 and #2 at the same time, without making bodily adjustments, to keep from making a mess on the floor. Other than that it a pretty good product
customer_reviews.author: H. N. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Holder pot is shaped round and the seat is oblong this makes for a void opening at the back. When doing your business can cause poop to land on the floor not in the pot.
customer_reviews.author: TIM D.

customer_reviews.title: awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bedside toilet super sturdy especially for elderly who are immobile or no balance can be moved anywhere no need to place against the wall or anything
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product -- much better than hospital portable commodes
customer_reviews.text: My wife recently had surgery that will leave her mostly in bed for three months. We bought this commode to provide a bedside convenience. This device has fulfilled its function superbly. We station the commode by her bedside and drop down the arm nearest the bed so she can get onto the seat with minimum assistance. The padded seat is much more comfortable than the hard surface of the hospital portable commode. This commode is sturdy, easy to empty, and easy to clean. It was easy to assemble. I would definitely buy this product again!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer janet

customer_reviews.title: Bad seat design
customer_reviews.text: This seat is not durable. I have replaced it the third time and have spent more on the replacement seats than the chair. It is very steady and heavy steel. All three seats have broken in the same place (on the bar that supports the seats). I will not order another but will replace it.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed. the 2 plastic clips that hold the seat on were cracked. totally worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well
customer_reviews.text: Wie has MS and needs to use commode all the time. This unit comes all assembled except for the back. It is very sturdy, and comfortable. My wife likes it a lot better than her old unit. Would recommend to anyone needing such a device.
customer_reviews.author: JoeZ

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable and the drop arms allow for a smooth transfer ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this seat over the toilet seat, not as a separate commode. It is comfortable and the drop arms allow for a smooth transfer from wheelchair to toilet. If the seat is raised to a higher position, recommend using the plastic guide piece
customer_reviews.author: Armeather Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy legs but cheap plastic seat hinges
customer_reviews.text: Dislike: product appears used. Barely any packaging onlyaround 1 armrest and seat hinge was broken (made of plastic--better design to use metal seat hinge). Flimsy bucket holder with minimal support. Like: Padded cushion
customer_reviews.author: lawrence louie

customer_reviews.title: love love and love this product
customer_reviews.text: love love and love this product. quality product. well build and comfortable. I recommend this product. i am very happy with my product. thank you seller.
customer_reviews.author: godforme

customer_reviews.title: Seat straps were broken
customer_reviews.text: I like the style of chair and needed it for my Mother. The straps that hold the seat down we’re both broken. So every time she sat down the seat would move. I contacted customer service sent in pictures waiting on a response because I need to keep the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Potts

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: This chair has been a life saver, my mother is an amputee and allows her independence in the bathroom, comfortable and very safe.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Transfer potty chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is what we need very good for transfer. In & out.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra Henley

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: The commode is great, but difficult to put together. Had it not been for a kind neighbor, I would not have been able to use. We are using this as an over-the-toilet addition as I recover from back surgery. Be careful when you place it to make sure there are no "misses"! This has been a lifesaver and the price was right!
customer_reviews.author: Lauri G.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, safe, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom who needs a bedside commode and the quality is great. She feels secure, and is able to sit comfortably for as long as it takes. I recommend putting a towel or disposable chuck underneath of it in case of any spillage -- doesn't happen often but as other reviewers have noted, the bucket needs to be in the right place. Definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy S

customer_reviews.title: Quality concerns
customer_reviews.text: Commode arrived today. There is a hole in the upholstery of the back, both arms are rickety, and the bucket/splash guard is grey, not white as shown in the picture. Customer support is not open today, hopefully these issues can be resolved, otherwise I will return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne McLaughlin

product_meta.title: Medline Heavy Duty Padded Drop-Arm Commode
feature_bullets: Arms swing out of the way for easier lateral transfers on and off the commode
Transfers are easier for patients using a wheelchair. Not latex free
Place near the bed with near arm down for patients transferring during the night
Padded Commode, G98204: 350-lb. (159 kg) Weight capacity; Seat height range, 20"-25" (51 cm-64 cm); Seat depth, 18"-20" (46 cm-51 cm); Width between arms, 18.5" (47 cm); Overall width, 22" (56 cm)

Non-Padded Commode, G98202: 300-lb. (136 kg) Weight capacity; Seat height range, 18.25"-23.25" (46 cm-59 cm); Seat depth, 18"-20" (46 cm-51 cm); Width between arms, 18.5" (47 cm); Overall width, 22" (56 cm)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
